abstract: Day 1 of the New York Times crossword puzzle contest, featuring puzzles by Patrick Blindauer.
snippet: Day 1 of the New York Times crossword puzzle contest, featuring puzzles by Patrick Blindauer.
lead_paragraph: Administrivial Puzzle Contest Alert! All the puzzles this week, from Monday to Saturday, have been created by one person, Patrick Blindauer. Keep your solutions handy, because the Saturday puzzle conceals a meta-challenge involving the solution grids of all six. When you have the answer to the meta-challenge, send it to crossword@nytimes.com. (Please do not post them here on the blog; they will not be counted as submissions.) Twenty correct solvers, chosen at random, whose entries are received by 6:00 p.m. Eastern time Sunday, Oct. 26, will win one-year online subscriptions to The New York Times crossword. Only one entry a person, please. The answer and winners’ names will appear on Friday, Oct. 31, at www.nytimes.com/wordplay. Good luck to all who enter!
